definitions: having or showing knowledge of events before they happen through supernatural or intuitive powers
relating to or characteristic of a prophet or prophecy in religious contexts
examples: Her prophetic dreams about the storm saved many lives
The economist made several prophetic statements about the market crash
The prophetic books of the Bible contain divine revelations
His prophetic voice thundered warnings from the pulpit

definitions: intended to prevent disease or infection through preventive measures or treatments
serving to prevent or protect against something undesirable or harmful in any context
examples: The doctor prescribed prophylactic antibiotics before the surgery
Regular handwashing is a simple prophylactic measure against illness
The company took prophylactic legal action to avoid lawsuits
Installing surge protectors is a prophylactic step against electrical damage

definitions: having parts that are in correct relation to each other in size, amount, or degree
examples: The architect designed rooms with proportional dimensions to create harmony
Salary increases should be proportional to employee performance and experience
The punishment was proportional to the severity of the crime
Mix ingredients in proportional amounts for the recipe to work

definitions: being in due proportion with something else in size, amount, or degree
examples: The response was proportionate to the level of threat they faced
Each heir received a proportionate share of the family estate
Teachers give proportionate attention to students based on their needs
The fine was proportionate to the company's ability to pay

definitions: relating to ownership, especially by a person or company with exclusive rights
relating to information or products that are secret, confidential, or protected by patent
examples: The restaurant refused to share its proprietary recipe for the sauce
This proprietary software requires a license for each user
He had a proprietary attitude toward his research findings
The company's proprietary technology gave them a competitive advantage

definitions: having the quality of driving or pushing something forward with force or energy
examples: The rocket's propulsive force launched it into orbit successfully
The novel has a propulsive narrative that keeps readers engaged
Her propulsive energy motivated the entire team to work harder
The propulsive rhythm of the drums drove the dancers forward

definitions: lacking imagination or excitement; commonplace and uninteresting in a mundane way
written or expressed in prose rather than poetry; straightforward and factual
examples: His prosaic description of the sunset failed to capture its beauty
She preferred a prosaic lifestyle without drama or adventure
The lawyer's prosaic language contrasted with the poet's flowery speech
The report was written in prosaic terms without any embellishment

definitions: forbidden or condemned, especially by law or social custom as harmful or unacceptable
examples: The proscribed substances were removed from all store shelves immediately
Speaking against the government was a proscribed activity under the regime
The club has a list of proscribed behaviors in its rulebook
Certain proscribed books were banned from the school library

definitions: expected or expecting to be something particular in the future
regarding the future rather than the past; potential rather than actual
examples: The prospective bride tried on several wedding dresses before choosing
All prospective employees must pass a background check
The prospective benefits of the merger outweighed the risks
They showed the house to several prospective buyers this week

definitions: experiencing success, wealth, or good fortune at the present time
examples: The prospering business expanded to three new locations this year
The prospering community attracted many new families to the area
Their prospering relationship grew stronger with each passing month
The prospering economy created thousands of new job opportunities

definitions: having financial success, wealth, and good fortune in business or life
examples: The prosperous merchant owned several shops throughout the city
They lived in a prosperous neighborhood with manicured lawns
The prosperous nation enjoyed high standards of living for citizens
After years of struggle, she finally built a prosperous career

definitions: relating to the prostate gland in the male reproductive system near the bladder
examples: The doctor ordered a prostate exam for the patient over fifty
Prostate cancer screening is recommended for men of certain ages
He experienced prostate problems that required medical attention immediately
The prostate surgery was successful in treating his condition

definitions: relating to or affecting the prostate gland in medical or anatomical contexts
examples: The prostatic fluid is an important component of male reproductive function
His prostatic symptoms required immediate evaluation by a urologist
The prostatic tissue sample was sent to the laboratory for analysis
Prostatic enlargement is common in older men and may need treatment

definitions: relating to an artificial device that replaces a missing body part or enhances function
examples: The veteran was fitted with a prosthetic leg after his injury
Modern prosthetic hands can perform surprisingly delicate movements
The prosthetic eye was so realistic that few people noticed it
She works at a clinic specializing in prosthetic limb design

definitions: lying stretched out on the ground with face downward in submission or exhaustion
completely overcome or helpless with grief, exhaustion, or emotion
examples: The worshippers lay prostrate before the altar in deep reverence
The exhausted runner fell prostrate after crossing the finish line
She was prostrate with grief after hearing the terrible news
The heat left everyone prostrate and unable to continue working

definitions: kept safe from harm, damage, or unauthorized access through defensive measures
examples: The protected species cannot be hunted or captured by law
All files are stored in a protected folder requiring special access
The protected witness testified from behind a special screen
Children should play in protected areas away from traffic

definitions: actively keeping someone or something safe from harm or damage
examples: The protecting wall kept the village safe from flood waters
Mother birds are fierce when protecting their young from predators
The protecting layer of ozone shields Earth from harmful radiation
Security guards were protecting the valuable artwork during transport

definitions: relating to or belonging to any Western Christian church that separated from the Roman Catholic Church during the Reformation
examples: The protestant church held services every Sunday morning at ten
Many protestant denominations share similar core beliefs about salvation
The protestant reformation changed the religious landscape of Europe forever
She was raised in a protestant family with strong religious values

definitions: being the first, earliest, or original form of something from which others develop
examples: Scientists discovered proto human fossils dating back millions of years
The proto language evolved into several modern European languages
This proto computer was the ancestor of all modern machines
The proto democracy in Athens influenced later government systems

definitions: representing the most typical or perfect example of a type or category
examples: The prototypical American diner serves burgers, fries, and milkshakes
She was the prototypical student athlete, excelling in both areas
His behavior was prototypical of teenagers going through rebellious phases
The building represents prototypical Victorian architecture of the period

definitions: lasting for a long time or longer than expected, often tediously so
examples: The protracted negotiations finally ended after six months of talks
Their protracted legal battle drained both parties financially and emotionally
The protracted drought caused severe damage to the agricultural sector
After a protracted illness, she finally began to show improvement

definitions: extending beyond or above a surface or boundary in a noticeable way
examples: The protruding rock made the hiking trail dangerous for climbers
His protruding teeth gave him a distinctive appearance
Be careful of protruding nails when walking on the old deck
The protruding balcony offered a panoramic view of the city

definitions: capable of being demonstrated as true or valid through evidence or logical argument
examples: The scientist's hypothesis was provable through repeated controlled experiments
Only provable facts should be presented as evidence in court
Her alibi was easily provable with security camera footage
Mathematical theorems must be provable using accepted axioms and logic

definitions: demonstrated to be true, valid, or genuine through evidence or experience
examples: The proved theory revolutionized our understanding of physics completely
His proved loyalty earned him a position of trust
The proved remedy became the standard treatment for the disease
Their proved track record attracted many new investors to company

definitions: established as true, effective, or reliable through testing, experience, or evidence
examples: The proven method has helped thousands lose weight successfully
She hired only proven professionals with strong track records
This proven technology has been used safely for decades worldwide
The proven benefits of exercise include better health and mood

definitions: relating to or resembling a proverb or well-known saying
so well known that it has become symbolic or representative of something
examples: He was caught between the proverbial rock and hard place
The proverbial early bird does indeed catch the worm
She had the proverbial Midas touch in business ventures
They searched for the proverbial needle in a haystack

definitions: making provisions for the future through careful planning and thrifty use of resources
examples: The provident squirrel stored nuts for the long winter ahead
Her provident nature led her to save half her income
Provident planning helped the family weather the economic downturn successfully
The provident investor diversified his portfolio to minimize risk

definitions: relating to a province or region outside the capital or major cities
having a limited or narrow outlook characteristic of unsophisticated areas
examples: The provincial government announced new regulations for rural schools
She enjoyed the slower pace of provincial life after city living
His provincial attitudes clashed with the cosmopolitan views of colleagues
Don't be so provincial; try food from different cultures

definitions: arranged or existing for the present, possibly to be changed later
examples: The provisional government ruled until democratic elections could be held
She received a provisional license while waiting for the permanent one
The provisional schedule is subject to change based on weather
They signed a provisional agreement pending final negotiations

definitions: causing annoyance, anger, or strong reactions, especially deliberately to stimulate discussion
intended to arouse sexual desire or interest through appearance or behavior
examples: The artist's provocative sculpture sparked heated debates about censorship
His provocative comments were designed to challenge conventional thinking
She wore a provocative dress that turned heads at the party
The provocative advertisement was banned for being too suggestive

definitions: stimulated or incited to feel or do something, especially through deliberate annoyance
examples: The provoked bear charged at the hikers who got too close
His provoked response showed how deeply the insult had affected him
The provoked crowd began shouting at the controversial speaker
She felt provoked into defending her position more forcefully

definitions: causing annoyance, anger, or other strong reactions, often deliberately
examples: His provoking behavior in class disrupted the learning environment
The provoking article challenged readers to reconsider their beliefs
Stop making provoking gestures at your sister during dinner
The provoking question led to an hour-long philosophical debate

definitions: nearest in space, time, or relationship to something
immediately preceding or following in a chain of events or causation
examples: The proximate cause of the accident was the driver's distraction
They searched for lodging proximate to the conference center
The proximate reason for resignation was stress, though other factors existed
The proximate towns were evacuated due to the volcanic threat

definitions: acting with or showing care and thought for the future consequences of actions
examples: The prudent investor diversified her portfolio to minimize potential losses
It would be prudent to check the weather before hiking
Her prudent management of resources saved the company during recession
Prudent drivers always wear seatbelts and follow traffic laws

definitions: involving or showing care and forethought, especially in business or financial matters
examples: The board made several prudential decisions to protect shareholder interests
Prudential regulations help banks maintain adequate capital reserves
Her prudential approach to spending allowed comfortable retirement savings
The prudential committee reviewed all major investment proposals carefully

definitions: not genuine but having the appearance of being so; false or pretended
examples: The pseudo expert gave advice without any real qualifications
He adopted a pseudo British accent to seem more sophisticated
The pseudo science claimed miraculous cures without any evidence
Her pseudo concern masked her real intentions to profit

definitions: written or published under a false name to conceal the author's identity
examples: The pseudonymous author revealed her identity years after publication
Many pseudonymous bloggers write about controversial topics freely
The pseudonymous letter to the editor criticized local government policies
Several famous writers began their careers with pseudonymous works

definitions: falsely or mistakenly claimed to be based on scientific method or knowledge
examples: The pseudoscientific theory about alien pyramids lacks credible evidence
Many pseudoscientific health products make unverifiable claims about benefits
His pseudoscientific explanation mixed real facts with wild speculation
The journal rejected the paper for its pseudoscientific methodology

definitions: relating to drugs that produce hallucinations and expansion of consciousness
having intensely vivid colors, sounds, or patterns reminiscent of hallucinogenic experiences
examples: The psychedelic substances were studied for potential therapeutic uses
His psychedelic experience changed his perspective on consciousness
The psychedelic poster featured swirling colors and abstract patterns
The band's psychedelic music defined the sound of the sixties

definitions: relating to the study and treatment of mental illness by medical doctors
examples: The psychiatric ward provided specialized care for mental health patients
She received psychiatric treatment for severe depression and anxiety
His psychiatric evaluation was required before the trial could proceed
The psychiatric nurse administered medications and monitored patient progress

definitions: relating to the human mind or psyche rather than the physical body
claiming to have supernatural mental powers such as telepathy or clairvoyance
examples: The psychic trauma from the accident required years of therapy
Her psychic energy was depleted after the emotional confrontation
The psychic claimed she could communicate with deceased relatives
He visited a psychic hoping to learn about his future

definitions: relating to phenomena that appear to be outside physical laws, involving the mind
examples: The psychical research society investigated claims of telepathy scientifically
She reported psychical experiences that couldn't be explained rationally
The psychical phenomena in the house attracted paranormal investigators
His interest in psychical studies led him to explore meditation

definitions: affecting the mind or mental processes by altering brain chemistry, mood, or consciousness
examples: Caffeine is a mild psychoactive substance consumed worldwide daily
The psychoactive medication helped stabilize her mood swings effectively
Many psychoactive drugs are controlled due to their potential for abuse
The psychoactive effects of the plant have been known for centuries

definitions: relating to the method of analyzing mental and emotional processes based on Freudian theories
examples: The psychoanalytic approach explores unconscious motivations behind behavior patterns
Her psychoanalytic training emphasized the importance of early childhood
The psychoanalytic interpretation of dreams reveals hidden desires and fears
He underwent psychoanalytic therapy to address deep-seated emotional issues

definitions: relating to or using the methods of psychoanalysis to understand behavior and mental processes
examples: The psychoanalytical study examined the symbolism in children's drawings
His psychoanalytical perspective influenced how he interpreted patient behaviors
The psychoanalytical treatment lasted several years of regular sessions
She wrote a psychoanalytical critique of the novel's main character

definitions: suffering from or showing symptoms of chronic mental disorder with abnormal or violent social behavior
examples: The psychopathic killer showed no remorse for his violent crimes
His psychopathic tendencies were evident in his manipulation of others
The psychopathic behavior included a complete lack of empathy
Psychopathic traits can sometimes be masked by superficial charm

definitions: relating to physical symptoms caused or aggravated by mental or emotional factors rather than organic disease
examples: Her psychosomatic illness improved when her stress levels decreased significantly
The doctor suspected psychosomatic causes for the unexplained pain
Psychosomatic symptoms are real even though they originate mentally
The psychosomatic response to anxiety included rapid heartbeat and sweating

definitions: suffering from psychosis involving loss of contact with reality, including delusions or hallucinations
examples: The psychotic patient required immediate hospitalization for everyone's safety
His psychotic episode was triggered by extreme stress and sleep deprivation
The psychotic symptoms included hearing voices and paranoid delusions
She was diagnosed with psychotic depression requiring specialized treatment

definitions: in the process of reaching sexual maturity during the teenage years
examples: The pubescent teenagers dealt with many physical and emotional changes
Her pubescent daughter was experiencing typical adolescent mood swings
The pubescent boy's voice cracked embarrassingly during his presentation
Pubescent acne is a common concern for many young people

definitions: relating to the pubis or the lower part of the abdomen at the front of the pelvis
examples: The pubic bone forms part of the pelvic structure in humans
Pubic hair typically appears during adolescence as bodies mature
The athlete suffered a painful pubic strain during the match
The pubic region was examined during the routine medical checkup
